required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diaphragmatic Paralysis in Arthroscopic Shoulder Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Diaphragmatic Paralysis in Arthroscopic Shoulder Surgery: Consequences and Causes

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to assess consequences and causes of hemidiaphragmatic paralysis for ambulatory arthroscopic shoulder surgery in patients with BMI ≥ 30 kg/m².

detailed_description.textblock: This prospective observational study will screen patients with body mass index (BMI) ≥30 kg/m² undergoing acromioplasty or supraspinatus tendon repair. Occurrence of post-operative hemidiaphragmatic paralysis will be observed using M-mode ultrasonography and its consequences on patient ventilation: arterial oxygen saturation, dyspnea, success of ambulatory procedure. Causes of diaphragmatic paralysis will be analyzed.

primary_outcome.measure: Failure of outpatient arthroscopic shoulder surgery strategy
primary_outcome.description: failure of outpatient arthroscopic shoulder surgery strategy is communly associated with dyspnea or hypoxia due to diaphragmatic paralysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of peripheral nerve block strategy associated with diaphragmatic paralysis
secondary_outcome.description: Different strategies of peripheral nerve block can be proposed for post-operative pain relief in arthroscopic shoulder surgery. All strategies were grouped in 3 parts: Interscalene block with high volume of local anesthetics Interscalene block with low volume of local anesthetics distal block

arm_group.description: Diaphragmatic paralysis can be associated with regional anesthesia procedure in arthroscopic shoulder surgery as phrenic nerve is close to the brachial plexus. Diaphragmatic paralysis will be defined using ultrasounds.
Some strategies of peripheral nerve block are able to spare diaphragmatic paralysis.

intervention.description: A diaphragmatic assessment will be performed using ultrasound. This is a pain free assessment. This assessment is commun in our unit after arthroscopic shoulder surgery.

study_pop.textblock: All patients with body mass index ≥ 30kg/m², undergoing ambulatory arthroscopic shoulder surgery (acromioplasty and supraspinatus tendon repair) will be screened.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients with body mass index ≥ 30kg/m², undergoing ambulatory arthroscopic shoulder surgery (acromioplasty and supraspinatus tendon repair) will be screened.
Exclusion Criteria:
age <18 years, brachial plexus neuropathies, severe bronchopulmonary disease, acute respiratory distress, coagulopathies, systemic glucocorticoid use, pregnancy, routine use of opioid medications, intolerance for one or more medications of the study protocol and diabetes.
